intro: Pedilonum brachycalyptra, commonly known as the narrow-capsule footplant, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, club-shaped fruit that remains attached to the plant for a prolonged period. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild aromatic scent. Native to specific regions in southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
